page.title: 03Farm size, crops, woods
page.content: In this area there are 13 farms, which vary in size from just over 100 acres to the largest one covering over 600 acres. The average size, however, is about 200 acres. There is an almost equal division between arable land and grassland. Winter wheat and winter barley are the major crops grown. The only other crops are maize (about 100 acres), and oats (about 50 acres). There are about 5 separate areas of deciduous woodland, varying from about half an acre to ten acres in size. The total area of woodland would be just under 20 acres. One small area is used by the Old Berks Hunt. Most of the grassland is permanent grass and grazing land.
